alert.note: Alert for Hertford; Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 9:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Northampton, western Hertford, Greensville, southeastern Mecklenburg, southwestern Southampton, southwestern Sussex and Brunswick Counties and the City of Emporia through 1100 PM EDT... At 957 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near South Hill to near Warrenton. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lawrenceville and Brunswick around 1015 PM EDT. Purdy and Radium around 1030 PM EDT. Emporia and Jarratt around 1035 PM EDT. Green Plain and Claresville around 1040 PM EDT. Rich Square and Woodland around 1050 PM EDT. Newsoms around 1100 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Eagletown, Milwaukee, Grizzard, Gum Forks, Menola, Bowens Corner, Yale, Pleasant Shade, Henrico and Jackson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and south central and southeastern Virginia.
